item.title: ME:: tl;dring: ChatBots, Completion coding products like Copiliot, Agentic products like Claude Code. LLM-generated feeds & video games from AI content may work soon ; Sean Goedecke:: Only three kinds of AI products actually work
item.description:
Discovered: Dec 13, 2025 08:49 (UTC) ME:: tl;dring: ChatBots, Completion coding products like Copiliot, Agentic products like Claude Code. LLM-generated feeds & video games from AI content may work soon ; Sean Goedecke:: Only three kinds of AI products actually work

QUOTE

By my count, there are three successful types of language model product:

  • Chatbots like ChatGPT, which are used by hundreds of millions of people for a huge variety of tasks
  • Completions coding products like Copilot or Cursor Tab, which are very niche but easy to get immediate value from
  • Agentic products like Claude Code, Codex, Cursor, and Copilot Agent mode, which have only really started working in the last six months

On top of that, there are two kinds of LLM-based product that don’t work yet but may soon:

  • LLM-generated feeds
  • Video games that are based on AI-generated content

item.title: Like the car industry, the bicycle industry doesn't care about safety. If they did they'd lobby for separated bicycle lanes and have turn signals, brake lights, etc as standard equipment on commuter bicycles
item.description:
• It goes without saying mandating speed limiters and other car safety measures would help a lot more than regulating or adding safety features to bicycles ; we should do both :-) !

    Previously

  • August 15, 2025: To the #WhitePersonSplainers :-) who tell me extending my right arm is not a valid right turn signal (nobody who’s not white has ever mansplained this to me in 17 years of bicycling in Vancouver: It is a valid signal ; See:: BC Motor Vehicle Act:: Bicyclists signal a right turn by doing either of the following … (ii) extending the person’s right hand and arm horizontally from the cycle

item.title: ME:: I wonder how many tokens this will burn :-) Again nobody talks about the $$$$$ i.e. the costs; Anand Chowdhary:: continuous-claude CLI tool: Running Claude Code in a loop
item.description:
Discovered: Dec 8, 2025 05:45 (UTC) ME:: I wonder how many tokens this will burn :-) Again nobody talks about the \(\)$ i.e. the costs; Anand Chowdhary:: continuous-claude CLI tool: Running Claude Code in a loop

QUOTE:

  • Read the whole thing: Anand Chowdhary:: continuous-claude CLI tool: Running Claude Code in a loop

Tools like Dependabot handle dependency updates, but Continuous Claude can also fix post-update breaking changes using release notes. You could run a GitHub Actions workflow every morning that checks for updates and continuously fixes issues until all tests pass.

Large refactoring tasks become manageable: breaking a monolith into modules, modernizing callbacks to async/await, or updating to new style guidelines. It could perform a series of 20 pull requests over a weekend, each doing part of the refactor with full CI validation. There’s a whole class of tasks that are too mundane for humans but still require attention to avoid breaking the build.

The model mirrors human development practices. Claude Code handles the grunt work, but humans remain in the loop through familiar mechanisms like PR reviews. Download the CLI from GitHub to get started: AnandChowdhary/continuous-claude

item.title: ME:: Recipes that probably work :-) ; Lauren Keating:: Sheet Pan Chicken Thighs With Root Vegetables ¦ Healthy Delicious
item.description:
Discovered: Dec 8, 2025 02:29 (UTC) ME:: Recipes that probably work :-) ; Lauren Keating:: Sheet Pan Chicken Thighs With Root Vegetables ¦ Healthy Delicious

QUOTEing the full recipe because I don’t trust the internet :-)

  • Read the whole thing: Lauren Keating:: Sheet Pan Chicken Thighs With Root Vegetables ¦ Healthy Delicious

Ingredients

  • 4 bone-in chicken thighs
  • Kosher salt
  • Cracked black pepper
  • ½ teaspoon crushed rosemary
  • 4 carrots peeled and diced
  • 1 turnip peeled and diced
  • 2 parsnips peeled and diced
  • Parsley for garnish

Instructions

  1. Heat your oven to 400ºF.
  2. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. Season generously with salt, pepper, and rosemary.
  3. Add the diced vegetables to the bottom of a casserole dish. Place the chicken skin-side up on top of the vegetables.
  4. Roast on the top rack of your oven for 40-50 minutes, until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165 degrees and the skin is crisp.
  5. Remove from the oven and let rest for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley.

item.title: The Hepatitis vaccination like all scientifically tested vaccinations saves lives.
item.description: Just like when people don’t vaccinate for measles and other preventable diseases, people are going to die unnecessarily if they don’t get their hepatitis vaccinations. And that’s on you Convicted Criminal and your cronies!

item.title: Super hilarious when Canadian bloggers, vloggers, etc recommend products that don't ship to Canada #RealFreeTradeWithEntireWorldNotJustSuperLoopholeFilledUSMCAWithTheUSAAndMexico
item.description:
• e.g. The Shifter guy in his YouTube video: Cycling Gift Guide 2025: Things I Actually Use recommending the Light Rail light from Intrinsic Cycles. I tried to buy it and LOL they don’t ship to Canada.
  • This happens all the time. Canada / USA free trade has always been a sham and scam. #BanMulroneyReaganEtcEtcNeverLikedThemNeverWill :-) #RealFreeTradeWithEntireWorldNotJustSuperLoopholeFilledUSMCAWithTheUSAAndMexico
  • Having said all the above, I do like the Shifter guy, Tom Babin, and his videos :-)

    Previously

  • November 30, 2025: ME:: Be seen plus SEE bicycle Light Rail light from Intrinsic Cycles looks good but how do I install this on my Wald basket (the basket blocks lights mounted on the handlebar)? Not a big deal I guess Wald basket bicyclists are not mainstream yet :-) Light Rail Kit – Intrinsic Cycles
